title: Global research trends on exercise and circadian rhythm: A bibliometric analysis.
author: Gu Yu, Xie Yongchao, Liu Wenduo, Wang Zilin, Seong Dong-Hun, Kim Sang Hyun
abstract: Recent advancements in the field of exercise and circadian rhythms have brought attention to the potential for tailored exercise strategies based on individual biological rhythms, aiming to optimize both health and performance, yet there is a lack of bibliometric analysis within this specific area of research. This study seeks to provide an extensive insight into the knowledge structure and primary research focuses on the correlation between exercise and circadian rhythms using bibliometric analysis. Publications pertinent to exercise and circadian rhythms were sourced from the Web of Science Core Collection (WoSCC) database. Utilizing VOSviewer, CiteSpace, and the R package "bibliometrix," a thorough bibliometric analysis was conducted. The analysis encompassed publications from 83 countries and 2025 institutions focusing on exercise and circadian rhythms. Leading contributors included the USA, England, France, Japan, and Germany, with an increasing number of publications annually. Notable institutions like Liverpool John Moores University, Univ Sfax, Brigham Women's Hosp, and Univ Milan ranked among the top contributors. Chronobiology International emerged as the most popular journal in this domain. These publications were attributed to 4402 authors, with Thomas Reilly and Greg Atkinson receiving the most citations, particularly Reilly being the most co-cited author. Dominant research topics included circadian rhythm, quality, skeletal muscle, and entrainment, while emerging hotspots comprised sports performance, mental health validity, older adults, and the sleep-wake cycle. This study marks the first comprehensive bibliometric analysis summarizing research trends and developments in exercise and circadian rhythms. This collection pinpoints the latest research frontiers and promising avenues, acting as a valuable resource for researchers investigating the connection between exercise and circadian rhythms.

This collection pinpoints the latest research frontiers and promising avenues, acting as a valuable resource for researchers investigating the connection between exercise and circadian rhythms.

title: Osseointegration of Dental Implants in Irradiated Patients: A Bibliometric Study.
author: Montoya-Mercado Jean, García-Herencia Rosabelle, Tinedo-López Pedro L, Espinoza-Carhuancho Fran, Pacheco-Mendoza Josmel, Mayta-Tovalino Frank
abstract:
BACKGROUND: To analyze the osseointegration of dental implants in irradiated patients through a bibliometric study.
MATERIALS AND METHODS: A descriptive and retrospective bibliometric study was conducted, focusing on English-language scientific publications indexed in Scopus from January 2018 to May 2024. To maintain quality and relevance, the study excluded abstracts, letters to the editor, book reviews, opinions, and symposium reports. The search, conducted on May 11, 2024, utilized the MeSH terms from the National Library of Medicine along with Boolean operators to refine the search. Relevant indicators such as citation count, publications by country, year, author, journal quartile, and more were examined. The data were analyzed using SciVal, Mendeley, Bibliometrix, and VOSviewer software.
RESULTS: The research identified 25 relevant papers, with an annual growth rate of 16.73%. The average number of citations per paper was 9.8, with a total of 846 references and 144 authors. German institutions led in scientific production, with the highest impact seen at Hospital Santa Catarina of Brazil. Brazilian authors showed the highest citation impact, while Heiland Max attained the highest h-index. Most publications were within the first (Q1,  = 14) and second (Q2,  = 6) quartiles, with 2021 standing out as the year with the highest impact. Collaboration maps highlighted international cooperation between several countries such as the USA, Spain, China, and Chile.
CONCLUSION: The study provides a comprehensive bibliometric analysis of osseointegration of dental implants in irradiated patients, highlighting key trends and collaborations in the field.
CLINICAL SIGNIFICANCE: This study underscores the clinical importance of osseointegration of dental implants in patients who have undergone radiation therapy. By providing insights into trends and collaborative networks, enhances our understanding of these patterns, which can improve treatment strategies, and patient outcomes, and guide future research. Ultimately, this advances the field of dental implantology for irradiated patients. How to cite this article: Montoya-Mercado J, García-Herencia R, Tinedo-López PL,  Osseointegration of Dental Implants in Irradiated Patients: A Bibliometric Study. J Contemp Dent Pract 2025;26(2):217-222.

title: ﻿Mites of the genus  (Acari, Tetranychidae): taxonomic notes on some species and a diagnostic key to the world species.
author: Mirza Jawwad Hassan, Elgoni Nasreldeen Ahmed, Kamran Muhammad, Alatawi Fahad Jaber
abstract: The present study aimed to develop taxonomic keys to the world species of the genus , categorized into three subgenera:  Livschits & Mitrofanov,  s. str. Koch, and  Livschits & Mitrofanov. Published descriptions, redescriptions, and illustrations of a total of 149 world species were thoroughly analyzed. The taxonomic notes on the status of the species in the species groups of each subgenus are discussed in detail. The variability of morphological characters found among different populations of a species is discussed. As a result, 116 species of the genus  were classified in three diagnostic keys, with 22, 43, and 51 species assigned to the three subgenera , , and , respectively. The population of  Tuttle & Baker from Utah, USA, should be re-identified through type examination due to differences from the original description of the species. Additionally, taxonomic notes are provided on the status of the remaining 33 species, and arguments are provided on suggested synonyms among them.

title: Quercetin and Nano-Derivatives: Potential and Challenges in Cancer Therapy.
author: Li Xin-Ru, Qi Lin, Zhang Xi-Wen, Wei Chao, Yu Bin, Pei Tian-Li
abstract: Quercetin, a prevalent flavonol compound, has gained attention for its multifaceted mechanisms of action against various cancers, highlighting its potential as an adjunctive therapy in cancer treatments. This review aims to systematically evaluate the structural optimization, mechanisms of action, and clinical applications of quercetin and its nano-derivatives in cancer treatment. Employing a bibliometric analysis of 6231 articles from the Web of Science Core Collection, we observed a notable increase in annual publications, particularly from the USA and China, indicating a growing interest in quercetin's therapeutic potential. Our findings reveal that quercetin enhances the efficacy of conventional therapies by modulating critical signaling pathways, thereby increasing cancer cell sensitivity while simultaneously protecting normal tissues from therapy-induced damage. Structural modifications, including glycosylation, methylation, sulfation, and glucuronidation, alongside nanoparticle formulation, significantly improve the stability, solubility, and bioavailability of quercetin, enabling targeted drug delivery. Despite the promising preclinical outcomes, the clinical translation of quercetin remains nascent, necessitating further rigorous research to validate its safety and efficacy in human subjects. In conclusion, while quercetin exhibits substantial anticancer properties and therapeutic potential, future studies should focus on expanding sample sizes, elucidating metabolic pathways, and conducting comprehensive clinical trials to inform its application in oncology.

title: Refilling Intrathecal Drug Delivery Pumps Outside the Clinic: Survey of Practice in the United Kingdom.
author: Kirker Stephen G B
abstract:
INTRODUCTION: Many people with spasticity or pain managed with intrathecal drug delivery pumps have very impaired mobility and are at high risk of developing pressure sores, which may prevent them from travelling to a clinic in their wheelchair. Some patients may be transported by stretcher, but some will be bedbound at home. Routinely refilling all pumps at home is established practice in several parts of Europe and USA.
METHOD: Freedom of information requests were emailed to trusts and health boards hosting intrathecal drug delivery services in the UK and Ireland, asking about frequency of home visits for pump refills, how many staff travelled, use of prefilled syringes and how they would manage a patient's long-term inability to attend clinic.
RESULTS: Detailed data was received from all but 1 of 54 active clinics in the UK, but Irish legislation did not allow this data to be returned. Two thousand one hundred forty-five patients were managed with intrathecal pumps in the UK. Eleven services had less than 10 patients and 5 had more than 100. Twenty-one services did less than 1 home refill/year and 9 did more than 12/year. Twenty had travelled to patients more than 50 miles from the clinic, or to an island. Twenty-two services would send 2 clinicians and 10 would bring prefilled sterile syringes, rather than aspirate from bottles at the bedside.
CONCLUSION: FoI requests can generate a very high response rate in the UK. Many services manage a small number of patients, which would make it difficult to provide cover when a single-handed clinician is unavailable or to train a second clinician.

title:
Current and Emergent Economic Impacts of Covid-19 and Brexit on UK Fresh
  Produce and Horticultural Businesses
author: Lilian Korir, Archie Drake, Martin Collison, Tania Carolina Camacho-Villa, Elizabeth Sklar, Simon Pearson
abstract:
This paper describes a study designed to investigate the current and emergent
impacts of Covid-19 and Brexit on UK horticultural businesses. Various
characteristics of UK horticultural production, notably labour reliance and
import dependence, make it an important sector for policymakers concerned to
understand the effects of these disruptive events as we move from 2020 into
2021. The study design prioritised timeliness, using a rapid survey to gather
information from a relatively small (n = 19) but indicative group of producers.
The main novelty of the results is to suggest that a very substantial majority
of producers either plan to scale back production in 2021 (47%) or have been
unable to make plans for 2021 because of uncertainty (37%). The results also
add to broader evidence that the sector has experienced profound labour supply
challenges, with implications for labour cost and quality. The study discusses
the implications of these insights from producers in terms of productivity and
automation, as well as in terms of broader economic implications. Although
automation is generally recognised as the long-term future for the industry
(89%), it appeared in the study as the second most referred short-term option
(32%) only after changes to labour schemes and policies (58%). Currently,
automation plays a limited role in contributing to the UK's horticultural
workforce shortage due to economic and socio-political uncertainties. The
conclusion highlights policy recommendations and future investigative
intentions, as well as suggesting methodological and other discussion points
for the research community.
translatedTitle: COVID-19およびBrexitが英国の生鮮農産物および園芸事業にもたらす、現在および顕在化しつつある経済的影響
translatedAbstract: 本稿は、Covid-19とBrexitが英国の園芸事業に現在および今後顕在化する影響を調査することを目的とした研究について述べる。英国の園芸生産は、特に労働力への依存と輸入依存度という様々な特性を持つため、2020年から2021年にかけての移行期において、これらの破壊的な出来事の影響を理解しようとする政策立案者にとって重要なセクターである。本調査の設計は即時性を優先し、比較的小規模（n=19）ながらも示唆に富む生産者グループから情報を収集するために迅速な調査を用いた。本研究結果の主な新規性は、生産者のかなりの大多数が、2021年には生産を縮小する計画である（47%）か、あるいは不確実性のために2021年の計画を立てることができていない（37%）かのいずれかであると示唆している点にある。また、本結果は、当該セクターが深刻な労働力供給の課題に直面し、それが労働コストと品質に影響を及ぼしているという、より広範な証拠を裏付けるものでもある。本研究では、生産者からのこれらの知見がもたらす影響を、生産性と自動化の観点から、またより広範な経済的影響の観点からも議論する。自動化は業界の長期的な未来として広く認識されている（89%）ものの、本研究では、短期的な選択肢としては、労働制度・政策の変更（58%）に次いで2番目に多く言及された（32%）。現在、経済的および社会政治的な不確実性のため、自動化は英国の園芸部門における労働力不足の解消に貢献する上で限定的な役割しか果たしていない。結論では、政策提言と今後の調査意図を強調し、研究コミュニティ向けの調査手法やその他の議論点も示唆している。

title: Modelling the emergence of spatial patterns of economic activity
author: Jung-Hun Yang, Dick Ettema, Koen Frenken
abstract:
Understanding how spatial configurations of economic activity emerge is
important when formulating spatial planning and economic policy. A simple model
was proposed by Simon, who assumed that firms grow at a rate proportional to
their size, and that new divisions of firms with certain probabilities relocate
to other firms or to new centres of economic activity. Simon's model produces
realistic results in the sense that the sizes of economic centres follow a Zipf
distribution, which is also observed in reality. It lacks realism in the sense
that mechanisms such as cluster formation, congestion (defined as an overly
high density of the same activities) and dependence on the spatial distribution
of external parties (clients, labour markets) are ignored.
  The present paper proposed an extension of the Simon model that includes both
centripetal and centrifugal forces. Centripetal forces are included in the
sense that firm divisions are more likely to settle in locations that offer a
higher accessibility to other firms. Centrifugal forces are represented by an
aversion of a too high density of activities in the potential location. The
model is implemented as an agent-based simulation model in a simplified spatial
setting. By running both the Simon model and the extended model, comparisons
are made with respect to their effects on spatial configurations. To this end a
series of metrics are used, including the rank-size distribution and indices of
the degree of clustering and concentration.
translatedTitle: 経済活動における空間パターンの創発のモデル化
translatedAbstract:
経済活動の空間的配置がどのように出現するかを理解することは、空間計画および経済政策を策定する上で重要である。サイモンは、企業が自身の規模に比例する速度で成長し、企業の新規部門が、ある確率で他の企業または新たな経済活動の中心地へと移転すると仮定したシンプルなモデルを提案した。サイモンモデルは、経済中心地の規模がジップ分布に従うという点で現実的な結果をもたらし、これは現実でも観察されている。しかし、クラスター形成、混雑（同一活動の過度な高密度と定義される）、および外部主体（顧客、労働市場）の空間分布への依存といったメカニズムが無視されているという点で、現実性に欠ける。

本稿では、求心力と遠心力の双方を含むサイモンモデルの拡張を提案する。求心力は、企業の部門が他の企業へのアクセス性が高い場所に定着しやすいという点で組み込まれる。遠心力は、潜在的な立地における活動の過度な高密度に対する忌避によって表現される。このモデルは、簡略化された空間設定において、エージェントベースシミュレーションモデルとして実装される。サイモンモデルと拡張モデルの両方を実行することで、それらが空間的配置に及ぼす影響に関して比較が行われる。この目的のために、順位規模分布、集積度、集中度の指標を含む一連の指標が用いられる。

title: Evolution of family systems and resultant socio-economic structures
author: Kenji Itao, Kunihiko Kaneko
abstract:
Families form the basis of society, and anthropologists have characterised
various family systems. This study developed a multi-level evolutionary model
of pre-industrial agricultural societies to simulate the evolution of family
systems and determine how each of them adapts to environmental conditions and
forms a characteristic socio-economic structure. In the model, competing
societies evolve, which themselves comprise multiple evolving families that
grow through family labour. Each family has two strategy parameters: the time
children leave the parental home and the distribution of inheritance among
siblings. The evolution of these parameters demonstrates that four basic family
systems emerge; families can become either nuclear or extended, and have either
an equal or unequal inheritance distribution. Nuclear families emerge where
land resources are sufficient, whereas extended families emerge where land
resources are limited. Equal inheritance emerges where the amount of wealth
required for a family to survive is large, whereas unequal inheritance emerges
where the required wealth is small. Analyses on the wealth distribution of
families demonstrate a higher level of poverty in extended families, and that
the accumulation of wealth is accelerated for unequal inheritance. By comparing
wealth distributions in the model with historical data, family systems are
associated with characteristic economic structures and modern social
ideologies. Empirical data analyses using the cross-cultural ethnographic
database verify the theoretical relationship between the environmental
conditions, family systems, and socio-economic structures. Theoretical studies
by this simple constructive model, as presented here, will integrate the
understandings of family systems in evolutionary anthropology, demography, and
socioeconomic histories.
translatedTitle: 家族システムの進化とそれに伴う社会経済構造
translatedAbstract: 家族は社会の基盤を形成し、人類学者は多様な家族システムを特徴づけてきた。本研究は、産業革命以前の農業社会を対象とした多層進化モデルを開発し、家族システムの進化をシミュレートするとともに、それぞれのシステムが環境条件にどのように適応し、特徴的な社会経済構造を形成するかを解明した。本モデルでは、競争する社会が進化し、それらの社会自体は家族労働を通じて成長する複数の進化する家族から構成される。各家族は、「子どもが親元を離れる時期」と「兄弟姉妹間の相続財産の分配」という2つの戦略パラメータを持つ。これらのパラメータの進化は、4つの基本的な家族システムが出現することを示す。すなわち、家族は核家族化するか拡大家族化するかのいずれかであり、均等相続または不均等相続のいずれかの遺産分配を持つ。土地資源が十分な場所では核家族が出現し、一方、土地資源が限られている場所では拡大家族が出現する。家族が生存するために必要な富の量が大きい場所では均等相続が出現し、一方、必要な富が小さい場所では不均等相続が出現する。家族の富の分布に関する分析は、拡大家族においてより高い貧困レベルを示し、不均等相続においては富の蓄積が加速されることを明らかにした。本モデルにおける富の分布を歴史データと比較することで、家族システムが特徴的な経済構造および現代の社会イデオロギーと関連していることが示された。異文化民族誌データベースを用いた実証データ分析は、環境条件、家族システム、社会経済構造間の理論的関係性を検証する。ここで提示されたこの単純な構成的モデルによる理論的研究は、進化人類学、人口学、社会経済史における家族システムの理解を統合するだろう。

title:
In the Shadow of Smith`s Invisible Hand: Risks to Economic Stability and
  Social Wellbeing in the Age of Intelligence
author: Jo-An Occhipinti, William Hynes, Ante Prodan, Harris A. Eyre, Roy Green, Sharan Burrow, Marcel Tanner, John Buchanan, Goran Ujdur, Frederic Destrebecq, Christine Song, Steven Carnevale, Ian B. Hickie, Mark Heffernan
abstract:
Work is fundamental to societal prosperity and mental health, providing
financial security, identity, purpose, and social integration. The emergence of
generative artificial intelligence (AI) has catalysed debate on job
displacement. Some argue that many new jobs and industries will emerge to
offset the displacement, while others foresee a widespread decoupling of
economic productivity from human input threatening jobs on an unprecedented
scale. This study explores the conditions under which both may be true and
examines the potential for a self-reinforcing cycle of recessionary pressures
that would necessitate sustained government intervention to maintain job
security and economic stability. A system dynamics model was developed to
undertake ex ante analysis of the effect of AI-capital deepening on labour
underutilisation and demand in the economy. Results indicate that even a
moderate increase in the AI-capital-to-labour ratio could increase labour
underutilisation to double its current level, decrease per capita disposable
income by 26% (95% interval, 20.6% - 31.8%), and decrease the consumption index
by 21% (95% interval, 13.6% - 28.3%) by mid-2050. To prevent a reduction in per
capita disposable income due to the estimated increase in underutilization, at
least a 10.8-fold increase in the new job creation rate would be necessary.
Results demonstrate the feasibility of an AI-capital- to-labour ratio threshold
beyond which even high rates of new job creation cannot prevent declines in
consumption. The precise threshold will vary across economies, emphasizing the
urgent need for empirical research tailored to specific contexts. This study
underscores the need for governments, civic organisations, and business to work
together to ensure a smooth transition to an AI- dominated economy to safeguard
the Mental Wealth of nations.
translatedTitle: スミスの不可視の手の影で：知能の時代における経済的安定と社会的厚生に対するリスク
translatedAbstract: 労働は、経済的安定、アイデンティティ、目的意識、社会との統合をもたらし、社会の繁栄と精神的健康の基盤をなす。生成AI（人工知能）の出現は、雇用の置き換えに関する議論を加速させてきた。一部には、多くの新規雇用と産業が生まれ、この置き換えを相殺すると主張する声がある一方で、経済生産性と人間の投入との広範な乖離が生じ、前例のない規模で雇用が脅かされると予測する声もある。本研究は、これら両方が同時に起こり得る条件を探り、雇用の安定と経済的安定を維持するために持続的な政府の介入を必要とする自己増幅的な不況圧力のサイクルの可能性を検証する。経済における労働力の過小利用と需要に対するAI資本深化の影響を事前分析するため、システムダイナミクスモデルを開発した。結果は、AI資本労働比率がわずかに増加するだけでも、2050年半ばまでに労働力の過小利用が現在の2倍に増加し、一人当たりの可処分所得が26%（95%信頼区間：20.6%～31.8%）、消費指数が21%（95%信頼区間：13.6%～28.3%）減少する可能性を示している。推定される過小利用の増加による一人当たりの可処分所得の減少を防ぐためには、新規雇用創出率を少なくとも10.8倍に増加させる必要がある。結果は、AI資本労働比率には、新規雇用創出率が高くても消費の減少を防ぐことができない閾値が存在しうることを示している。この正確な閾値は経済によって異なり、特定の状況に合わせた実証研究が緊急に必要であることを強調している。本研究は、国家のメンタル・ウェルスを保護するため、政府、市民団体、企業が協力し、AIが主導する経済への円滑な移行を確実にする必要性を強調している。

title:
Inequality, mobility and the financial accumulation process: A
  computational economic analysis
author: Simone Righi, Yuri Biondi
abstract:
Our computational economic analysis investigates the relationship between
inequality, mobility and the financial accumulation process. Extending the
baseline model by Levy et al., we characterise the economic process through
stylised return structures generating alternative evolutions of income and
wealth through time. First, we explore the limited heuristic contribution of
one and two factors models comprising one single stock (capital wealth) and one
single flow factor (labour) as pure drivers of income and wealth generation and
allocation over time. Second, we introduce heuristic modes of taxation in line
with the baseline approach. Our computational economic analysis corroborates
that the financial accumulation process featuring compound returns plays a
significant role as source of inequality, while institutional arrangements
including taxation play a significant role in framing and shaping the aggregate
economic process that evolves over socioeconomic space and time.
translatedTitle: 格差、流動性、金融蓄積過程：計算経済学的分析
translatedAbstract: 我々の計算経済学分析は、不平等、移動性、金融蓄積プロセスの関係を解明する。Levy et al. によるベースラインモデルを拡張し、時間を通じて所得と富の代替的な推移を生み出すスタイライズされた収益構造を通じて、経済プロセスを特徴づける。まず、単一のストック（資本富）と単一のフロー要素（労働）から構成される1要素および2要素モデルが、時間にわたる所得と富の生成および配分の純粋な推進要因として果たす限られたヒューリスティックな寄与について考察する。次に、ベースラインのアプローチに沿ったヒューリスティックな課税方式を導入する。我々の計算経済学分析は、複利リターンを特徴とする金融蓄積プロセスが不平等の源泉として重要な役割を果たす一方で、課税を含む制度的取り決めが、社会経済的な空間と時間を通じて展開する集計経済プロセスを枠付け、形成する上で重要な役割を果たすことを実証する。

title: Economic interactions and the distribution of wealth
author: Davide Fiaschi, Matteo Marsili
abstract:
This paper analyzes the equilibrium distribution of wealth in an economy
where firms' productivities are subject to idiosyncratic shocks, returns on
factors are determined in competitive markets, dynasties have linear
consumption functions and government imposes taxes on capital and labour
incomes and equally redistributes the collected resources to dynasties. The
equilibrium distribution of wealth is explicitly calculated and its shape
crucially depends on market incompleteness. In particular, a Paretian law in
the top tail only arises if capital markets are incomplete. The Pareto exponent
depends on the saving rate, on the net return on capital, on the growth rate of
population and on portfolio diversification. On the contrary, the
characteristics of the labour market mostly affects the bottom tail of the
distribution of wealth. The analysis also suggests a positive relationship
between growth and wealth inequality.
translatedTitle: 経済的相互作用と富の分配
translatedAbstract: 本稿では、企業生産性が個別的なショックを受ける経済において、生産要素への収益が競争市場で決定され、家系が線形消費関数を持ち、政府が資本所得と労働所得に課税し、徴収された財源を家系に均等に再分配する場合の富の均衡分布を分析する。富の均衡分布は明示的に導出され、その形状は市場の不完全性に決定的に依存する。特に、富の分布の上位テイルにおけるパレートの法則は、資本市場が不完全な場合にのみ生じる。パレート指数は、貯蓄率、資本の純収益、人口成長率、およびポートフォリオ分散に依存する。対照的に、労働市場の特性は富の分布の下位テイルに主に影響を与える。本分析はまた、成長と富の不平等との間に正の関係があることを示唆する。

title: The Economic Effect of Gaining a New Qualification Later in Life
author: Finn Lattimore, Daniel M. Steinberg, Anna Zhu
abstract:
Pursuing educational qualifications later in life is an increasingly common
phenomenon within OECD countries since technological change and automation
continues to drive the evolution of skills needed in many professions. We focus
on the causal impacts to economic returns of degrees completed later in life,
where motivations and capabilities to acquire additional education may be
distinct from education in early years. We find that completing an additional
degree leads to more than \$3000 (AUD, 2019) extra income per year compared to
those who do not complete additional study. For outcomes, treatment and
controls we use the extremely rich and nationally representative longitudinal
data from the Household Income and Labour Dynamics Australia survey (HILDA). To
take full advantage of the complexity and richness of this data we use a
Machine Learning (ML) based methodology for causal effect estimation. We are
also able to use ML to discover sources of heterogeneity in the effects of
gaining additional qualifications. For example, those younger than 45 years of
age when obtaining additional qualifications tend to reap more benefits (as
much as \$50 per week more) than others.
translatedTitle: 人生の後期における新規資格取得の経済的効果
translatedAbstract: 技術変化と自動化が多くの職業で必要とされるスキルの進化を促進し続けているため、OECD加盟国において、後年での教育資格の取得はますます一般的な現象となっている。本稿では、後年に取得された学位が経済的リターンに与える因果的影響に焦点を当てる。その場合、追加の教育を受ける動機や能力は、若年期の教育におけるそれとは異なる可能性があるためである。我々の分析では、追加の学位を取得することは、追加の研究を行わない者と比較して、年間3000豪ドル（2019年）以上の追加収入につながることが分かった。分析には、結果変数、処置群、対照群を含め、オーストラリア世帯所得・労働力動態調査（HILDA）から得られた、非常に豊富で全国代表的な縦断的データを用いる。このデータの複雑さと豊富さを最大限に活用するため、我々は因果効果推定に機械学習（ML）に基づく手法を用いる。また、MLを用いることで、追加資格取得による効果の異質性の源泉を発見することも可能である。例えば、追加の資格を取得した時点で45歳未満であった者は、他の者と比較して、より多くの恩恵（週あたり最大50ドルの追加収入など）を享受する傾向が見られる。

title:
Autonomics: an autonomous and intelligent economic platform and next
  generation money tool
author: Benjamin Munro, Julia McLachlan
abstract:
We propose a high level network architecture for an economic system that
integrates money, governance and reputation. We introduce a method for issuing,
and redeeming a digital coin using a mechanism to create a sustainable global
economy and a free market. To maintain a currency's value over time, and
therefore be money proper, we claim it must be issued by the buyer and backed
for value by the seller, exchanging the products of labour, in a free market.
We also claim that a free market and sustainable economy cannot be maintained
using economically arbitrary creation and allocation of money. Nakamoto, with
Bitcoin, introduced a new technology called the cryptographic blockchain to
operate a decentralised and distributed accounts ledger without the need for an
untrusted third party. This blockchain technology creates and allocates new
digital currency as a reward for "proof-of-work", to secure the network.
However, no currency, digital or otherwise, has solved how to create and
allocate money in an economically non-arbitrary way, or how to govern and trust
a world-scale free enterprise money system. We propose an "Ontologically
Networked Exchange" (ONE), with purpose as its highest order domain. Each
purpose is defined in a contract, and the entire economy of contracts is
structured in a unified ontology. We claim to secure the ONE network using
economically non-arbitrary methodologies and economically incented human
behaviour. Decisions influenced by reputation help to secure the network
without an untrusted third party. The stack of contracts, organised in a
unified ontology, functions as a super recursive algorithm, with individual use
programming the algorithm, acting as the "oracle". The state of the algorithm
becomes the "memory" of a scalable and trustable artificial intelligence (AI).
This AI offers a new platform for what we call the "Autonomy-of-Things" (AoT).
translatedTitle: オートノミクス：自律的かつ知的な経済プラットフォームであり、次世代のマネーツール
translatedAbstract: 貨幣、ガバナンス、評判を統合する経済システムのための高水準ネットワークアーキテクチャを提案する。持続可能なグローバル経済と自由市場を創出するメカニズムを用いて、デジタルコインを発行・償還する方法を導入する。貨幣の価値を時間とともに維持し、それゆえに真の貨幣であるためには、自由市場において、労働の生産物を交換する形で、買い手によって発行され、売り手によってその価値が裏付けられる必要があると我々は主張する。また、貨幣の経済的に恣意的な創造と配分によっては、自由市場と持続可能な経済は維持できないと我々は主張する。ナカモトは、ビットコインによって、信頼できない第三者を必要とせずに分散型台帳を運用するための、暗号学的ブロックチェーンという新しい技術を導入した。このブロックチェーン技術は、ネットワークのセキュリティを確保するために、「プルーフ・オブ・ワーク」の報酬として新しいデジタル通貨を生成し、割り当てる。しかし、デジタル通貨であれその他であれ、経済的に恣意ではない方法で貨幣を創造し配分する方法、あるいは世界規模の自由企業貨幣システムを統治し信頼を構築する方法を解決した貨幣は未だ存在しない。我々は、「存在論的にネットワーク化された交換」（Ontologically Networked Exchange、略称ONE）を提案する。これは、目的をその最高位のドメインとするものである。各目的は契約において定義され、契約全体の経済は統一されたオントロジーとして構造化される。ONEネットワークは、経済的に恣意的ではない手法と、経済的にインセンティブ付けされた人間の行動を用いることで、セキュリティを確保できると我々は主張する。評判によって影響される意思決定は、信頼できない第三者を介さずにネットワークのセキュリティ確保に寄与する。統一されたオントロジーで組織された契約のスタックは、個々の利用がアルゴリズムをプログラミングする「オラクル」として機能する、超再帰的アルゴリズムとして働く。アルゴリズムの状態は、スケーラブルで信頼できる人工知能（AI）の「記憶」となる。このAIは、我々が「モノの自律性」（Autonomy-of-Things、略称AoT）と呼ぶもののための新しいプラットフォームを提供する。

title:
Structural Change, Employment, and Inequality in Europe: an Economic
  Complexity Approach
author: Bernardo Caldarola, Dario Mazzilli, Aurelio Patelli, Angelica Sbardella
abstract:
Structural change consists of industrial diversification towards more
productive, knowledge intensive activities. However, changes in the productive
structure bear inherent links with job creation and income distribution. In
this paper, we investigate the consequences of structural change, defined in
terms of labour shifts towards more complex industries, on employment growth,
wage inequality, and functional distribution of income. The analysis is
conducted for European countries using data on disaggregated industrial
employment shares over the period 2010-2018. First, we identify patterns of
industrial specialisation by validating a country-industry industrial
employment matrix using a bipartite weighted configuration model (BiWCM).
Secondly, we introduce a country-level measure of labour-weighted Fitness,
which can be decomposed in such a way as to isolate a component that identifies
the movement of labour towards more complex industries, which we define as
structural change. Thirdly, we link structural change to i) employment growth,
ii) wage inequality, and iii) labour share of the economy. The results indicate
that our structural change measure is associated negatively with employment
growth. However, it is also associated with lower income inequality. As
countries move to more complex industries, they drop the least complex ones, so
the (low-paid) jobs in the least complex sectors disappear. Finally, structural
change predicts a higher labour ratio of the economy; however, this is likely
to be due to the increase in salaries rather than by job creation.
translatedTitle: ヨーロッパにおける構造変化、雇用、不平等：経済複雑性アプローチ
translatedAbstract: 構造変化とは、より生産性が高く、知識集約的な活動への産業多角化から成る。しかし、生産構造の変化は、雇用創出と所得分配と本質的な関連性を持つ。本稿では、より複雑な産業への労働移動と定義される構造変化が、雇用成長、賃金格差、および機能的所得分配に与える影響を調査する。分析は、2010年から2018年の期間における細分化された産業雇用シェアのデータを用いて、欧州諸国を対象に実施された。まず、二部重み付きコンフィギュレーションモデル (BiWCM) を用いて、国・産業別の雇用マトリックスを検証することで、産業特化のパターンを特定する。第二に、国レベルの労働力加重型フィットネス指標を導入する。この指標は、より複雑な産業への労働移動（これを構造変化と定義する）を特定する要素を分離するように分解できる。第三に、構造変化をi) 雇用成長、ii) 賃金格差、そしてiii) 経済における労働分配率と関連付ける。結果は、我々の構造変化指標が雇用成長と負の関連を持つことを示している。しかし、同時に所得格差の縮小とも関連している。各国がより複雑な産業へと移行するにつれて、最も複雑度の低い産業から撤退するため、それらの部門の（低賃金の）雇用は消失する。最後に、構造変化は経済における労働分配率の増加を予測する。ただし、これは雇用創出によるものではなく、給与の増加による可能性が高い。

title:
Workforce migration and its economic implications: A perspective from
  social media in China
author: Xiaoqian Hu, Junjie Wu, Jichang Zhao
abstract:
The workforce remains the most basic element of social production, even in
modern societies. Its migration, especially for developing economies such as
China, plays a strong role in the reallocation of productive resources and
offers a promising proxy for understanding socio-economic issues. Nevertheless,
due to long cycle, expensive cost and coarse granularity, conventional surveys
face challenges in comprehensively profiling it. With the permeation of smart
and mobile devices in recent decades, booming social media has essentially
broken spatio-temporal constraints and enabled the continuous sensing of the
real-time mobility of massive numbers of individuals. In this study, we
demonstrate that similar to a natural shock, the Spring Festival culturally
drives workforce travel between workplaces and hometowns, and the trajectory
footprints from social media therefore open a window with unparalleled richness
and fine granularity to explore laws in national-level workforce migration. To
understand the core driving forces of workforce migration flux between cities
in China, various indicators reflecting the benefits and costs of migration are
introduced into our prediction model. We find that urban GDP (gross domestic
product) and travel time are two excellent indicators to help make predictions.
Diverse migration patterns are then revealed by clustering the trajectories,
which give important clues to help understand the different roles of Chinese
cities in their own development and in regional economic development. These
patterns are further explained as a joint effect of the subjective will to seek
personal benefits and the capacity requirements of local labour markets. Our
study implies that the non-negligible entanglement between social media and
macroeconomic behaviours can be insightful for policymaking in social-economic
issues.
translatedTitle: 労働力移動とその経済的影響：中国におけるソーシャルメディアからの視点
translatedAbstract:
労働力は、現代社会においてもなお、社会生産の最も基本的な要素である。その移動、特に中国のような発展途上経済圏においては、生産資源の再配分に重要な役割を果たし、社会経済的問題を理解するための有望な代替指標となる。しかしながら、従来の調査は、長い調査期間、高コスト、そして粗い粒度のため、その全体像を包括的に把握することにおいて課題に直面している。

近年、スマートデバイスやモバイルデバイスの普及に伴い、活況を呈するソーシャルメディアは、本質的に時空間的制約を打ち破り、膨大な数の個人のリアルタイムな移動を継続的にセンシングすることを可能にした。本研究では、自然界の衝撃と同様に、春節が文化的に労働力の職場と故郷間の移動を促進することを示し、ソーシャルメディアからの移動軌跡が、国家レベルの労働力移動における法則を探求するための、比類のない豊富さと詳細な粒度を持つ窓を開くことを実証する。

中国の都市間の労働力移動流動における中核的な推進力を理解するため、移動の便益と費用を反映する様々な指標を我々の予測モデルに導入した。その結果、都市GDP（国内総生産）と移動時間が予測を行う上で優れた二つの指標であることが明らかになった。次に、軌跡をクラスタリングすることによって多様な移動パターンが明らかにされ、これらは中国の各都市が自己の発展および地域経済発展において果たす異なる役割を理解するための重要な手がかりを提供する。これらのパターンはさらに、個人的な便益を追求する主観的な意思と、地域の労働市場の受容能力要件との複合的な効果として説明される。本研究は、ソーシャルメディアとマクロ経済行動との間に無視できないほどの密接な関連性があり、それが社会経済的問題における政策立案にとって示唆に富むことを示唆する。

title: The economics of diversity: Innovation, productivity and the labour market
author: Ceren Ozgen
abstract: The empirical evidence on the economic impacts of diversity is mixed. Many studies in the literature present context dependent and data driven results which are challenging to reconcile with each other. This paper offers a systematic synthesis of the empirical findings on the economic impacts of diversity on innovation, productivity, and the labour market. It presents a structured framework which takes the spatial scale of the analysis in the papers as a reference to understand the inconsistency of some previous predictions and the varying magnitudes of the diversity impact. The empirical findings reconcile more meaningfully when diversity effects are documented discretely at the regional, firm and individual levels. The paper further sets out an agenda for future research and links the findings for policy relevance.
translatedTitle: 多様性の経済学：イノベーション、生産性、労働市場
translatedAbstract: 多様性の経済的影響に関する実証的証拠は一様ではない。既存研究の多くは、文脈依存的かつデータに基づく結果を示しており、それらを互いに整合させることは困難である。本稿は、多様性がイノベーション、生産性、労働市場に与える経済的影響に関する実証的知見を体系的に統合するものである。本稿は、これまでの予測に見られる不整合性や、多様性効果の大きさのばらつきを理解するために、分析の空間的スケールを基準とした構造化された枠組みを提示する。多様性の効果が地域レベル、企業レベル、個人レベルで個別に検証されるとき、実証的知見はより有意義に整合する。本稿はさらに、今後の研究課題を提示し、その知見を政策的示唆と関連付ける。

title: The economics of migration: Labour market impacts and migration policies
author: Francesco Fasani, J. Llull, C. Tealdi
abstract: No abstract available

title: Survey of Members of the Indian Society of Labour Economics on the COVID-19 Crisis and Employment
author: G. Rodgers
